messages.message:
Example usage:

```
with temp_folder_from_instabase_fs(instabase_path, username, file_client) as temp_path:
  # At this point in the code the temp folder has been populated with the download
  custom_library.load_things_from(temp_path)
# Here the temp folder is cleaned up
```

```
with temp_folder_to_instabase_fs(instabase_path, username, file_client) as temp_path:
  # at this point a temp folder is created
  custom_library.write_things_to(temp_path)
# on scope closure sync to instabase drive occurs and temp folder cleaned up
```

PS The reason for the above is twofold:
1. Enable custom models that have been trained by a user (the main use)
2. Enable us to more easily remove our *standard* models from the Dockerfiles (if we choose to) and hot-load them from a special place on instabase drive
